  • Third , at the HNS-repressed bgl operon BglJ -- RcsB activates transcription synergistically with CRP . [24335284]
  • Finally , because of the necessity for data manipulation to identify only the most robust changes in transcription , promoters that are only weakly activated by CRP in vitro will not be detected . [15520470]
  • CRP also activates transcription at all three of the rha promoters . [15342598]
  • These data show that Fis and CRP activate transcription synergistically at proP P2 . [10894725]
  • We proposed that CRP activates transcription from acsP2 by a synergistic class III mechanism . [12923087]
  • By these criteria , CRP , a paradigm of activator of transcription , becomes bifunctional ; it activates and represses different steps of the initiation pathway . [15385551]
  • CRP activates transcription by using two different modes of RNAP interaction . [12881519]
  • Specific sequences to which the CRP and FNR proteins bind , to stimulate transcription , have been proposed . [2407723]
  • AraC and CRP were both required for maximal transcription in vitro , although a low level of transcription was detected with CRP alone . [2231717]
  • Effects of CRP and CAMP on in vitro transcription of the ompA gene . [7021177]
  • Here , we have shown that CRP and CAMP inhibit in vitro transcription of the ompA gene but not the Zppgene . [7021177]
  • CRP activates transcription in vitro by focusing RNAP to P2 . [12923087]
  • Using an in vitro transcription assay , we determined that CRP activates transcription of acs . [12923087]
  • CRP represses P1 transcription in vitro . [9079929]
  • CRP increases PcspD transcription in vitro . [24509317]
  • RESULTS Fis and CRP activate transcription synergistically in vitro at proP P2 . [10894725]
  • RhaR and CRP synergistically activate transcription of rhaSR in vitro . [16166533]
  • Both CRP I and CRP II contribute to acs transcription in vivo . [12923087]
  • Effects of FNR , CRP , and H-NS on in vivo transcription of hlyE . [14996792, 14996792]
  • Global transcription factors such as ArcA , Fnr , IHF , Fur , and CRP respond to both NADH and ATP . [20299454]
  • CRP is required to activate guaBA transcription and repress xseA transcription following downshift . [10856643]
  • CRP can activate or repress transcription . [7934815]
  • Consequently , it was assumed that TcbC somehow replaced CRP to activate transcription . [11251844]
  • Effect of CRP on P1 transcription as assayed by primer extension . [9079929]
  • Active CRP was then added , and at regular intervals samples were removed and assayed by runoff transcription . [3907860]
  • When CRP EV181 is introduced instead of wild-type CRP , transcription from the XX-CC promoter is increased , whereas expression from CC-CC is decreased by nearly twofold . [8748035]
  • Osmotic sensitivity of CRP -- cAMPmediated activation of the lac promoter was assessed by comparing activated transcription of the CRP-dependent wild-type lac promoter with the CRP-independent lacL8UV5 promoter after addition of 0.5 M NaCl to cells growing in LBN . [10601034]
  • Our study shows that both [ Leu159 Glu101 Asn52 ] CRP and wild-type CRP , in conditions where they can stimulate transcription and participate in ternary CRP-RNAP-galp1 complexes , have no effect on the location of s70 region 4 . [10781573]
  • When triggered by melibiose , wild-type MelR requires the assistance of CRP to activate transcription at pmelAB ( 31 ) . [16621812]
  • Maximal transcription was still dependent on AraC and CRP ; low levels of transcription , similar to those obtained with the wild type , were obtained for WH592 and WH603 with CRP alone . [1400237]
  • Together , these results suggest that while CRP may repress basal levels of setA transcription , neither CRP nor KdgR is likely to exert any direct effect on setA transcription under stress conditions . [20971900]
  • Recall that , in the conditions used in our experiments , direct effects of CRP on transcription of promoter : : lacZ fusions in pRW50 can be measured independent of the effect of CRP on s28 levels . [19843224]
  • It has been reported that even though the main role of the CAMP-CRP complex is to activate transcription , it can also , in some cases repress it , as it does in the case of the P2 promoter in the gal operon , and the ompA and clp promoters . [2465204]
  • Full transcription from the rhaBAD promoter requires CRP ( catabolite repression protein ) . [9409145]
  • Plasmid-borne promoter fusions to the receptor gene for chloramphenicol acetyl transferase were used to assess the role of CRP in controlling transcription from guaP and xseP following a downshift of cultures from rich into minimal medium . [10856643]
  • When AR2 is disrupted by mutation , or when either the promoter-distal CRP II or the promoter-proximal IHF III sites remain unoccupied , some of these upstream contacts are lost , and transcription can proceed . [17630973]
  • In this case , activating region 1 ( AR1 ) of the downstream monomer of CRP contacts the RNAP - CTD to recruit RNAP to the promoter and activate transcription ( reviewed in reference 9 ) . [16166533]
  • At the rhaBAD promoter , CRP can activate transcription only when RhaS is bound adjacent to RNAP ( 12 ; unpublished results ) . [16166533]
  • This indicates that CRP can not activate transcription from the aer promoter when bound at a Class II location . [19843224]
  • CRP is considered to behave as a simple transcription activator when it binds closer to the promoter start , i.e. , at positions 241.5 , 261.5 , and 271.5 ( 8 , 21 ) . [9573142]
  • First , some operons require other factors for CRP to activate transcription , e.g. AraC at the araBAD promoter ( 25 ) , which are missing in the ROMA system . [15520470]
  • When glucose or othe ( Table 3 ) , indicating that CRP is needed to activate transcription from the lsr promoter . [15743955]
  • In addition , the synchronized pattern of increasing CRP activity causing increasing FlhDC expression with decreasing carbon source quality , together with the apparent coupling of motility activity with the activation of motility and chemotaxis genes in poor quality carbon sources , highlights the importance of CRP activation in allowing E. coli to devote progressively more of its limited reserves to search out better conditions . [17576668]
  • The correlation between the activity of CRP and the motility of cells indicates that activation of CRP plays an important role in triggering E. coli ` foraging ' - like behavior ( 20 -- 22 ) to actively search for better conditions as the quality of the available substrate ( s ) decreases . [17576668]
  • The upregulation of motility genes correlated with increasing motility of cells in poor quality carbon sources , together with the synchronized pattern of increasing CRP activity causing increasing FlhDC transcription , further suggests CRP is a factor ( or at least one of multiple factors ) to play a positive role in triggering E. coli ` foraging ' - like behavior to actively search for better conditions as the quality of the available substrate ( s ) decreases . [17576668]
  • This stabilizing effect most likely results from the assembly of the higher-order structure formed by MalT and CRP at malEp-malKp . [9000616]
  • CRP bound to site 1 plays a speciﬁc role in malEp + activation The observation that CRP site 1 still strongly stimulated malEp in the absence of any distal MalT sites ( Raibaud et al. , 1989 ; Vidal-Ingigliardi et al. , 1991 ) suggested that the CRP molecule bound to site 1 might play an active role in malEp activation , besides its structural role in the assembly of the active complex . [9000616]
  • Discussion A unique nucleoprotein assembly activates malEp and malKp The MalT sites 1 and 2 , as well as the CRP sites 1 , 2 and 3 had all been shown to play a role in malEp activation ( Vidal-Ingigliardi & Raibaud , 1991 ; Vidal-Ingigliardi et al. , 1991 ) , but so far it was not clear which of the MalT sites present in the distal region are involved in promoter activation . [9000616]
  • One role of the higher-order structure formed by MalT and CRP when bound to the entire regulatory region is to ensure high occupation of MalT sites 1 and 2 , but it is not its only function . [9000616]
  • This study indeed revealed the following : ( 1 ) occupation of MalT sites 1 and 2 is sufﬁcient to promote malEp activation ; ( 2 ) in vivo , under conditions of full induction , the activity of the truncated malEpD64 promoter is severely limited by the degree of occupancy of MalT sites 1 and 2 ; ( 3 ) one role of the upstream regulatory elements is to stabilize MalT at sites 1 and 2 ; ( 4 ) full occupation of these sites is not sufﬁcient , however , to ensure full promoter activity ; ( 5 ) CRP site 1 and the upstream MalT sites can independently increase the capacity of MalT bound to sites 1 and 2 to stimulate malEp ; and ( 6 ) this effect of CRP bound to site 1 does not involve stabilization of MalT at sites 1 and 2 . [9000616]
  • Hence , this suggests that malEpD64 might actually represent a minimal MalT-dependent promoter that is inactive because of a too low occupation of MalT sites 1 and 2 , and that the role of the upstream elements in malEp activation might simply be to ensure high occupation of MalT sites 1 and 2 through the assembly of a higher-order structure with MalT and CRP . [9000616]
  • Some elements of this structure , namely the CRP site 1 , located at − 76.5 , and the distal MalT sites , seem to play a direct role in malEp activation besides their participation in the assembly of the higher-order structure . [9000616]
  • Formation of this structure is disfavored when MalT is present alone and the role of CRP in malKp activation is to facilitate the repositioning of MalT onto sites 3 ' / 4 ' / 5 ' by stabilizing this higher-order structure . [9000616]
  • Hence , malEp activation primarily relies on MalT sites 1/2 , 3 ' / 4 ' / 5 ' and on the CRP sites 1/2/3 , i.e. on the same set of regulatory elements as malKp activation . [9000616]
  • An insertion of one DNA helical turn , 11 base-pairs , between CRP and aral only partially inhibits CRP loop breaking and activation of pBAD , while an insertion of less than one DNA helical turn , 4 base-pairs , not only abolishes CRP activation and loop breaking , but actually causes CRP to stabilize the loop and increases the araO,-mediated repression of pBAD.Both integral and non-integral insertions of greater than one helical turn completely abolish CR , P activation and loop breaking in vitro . [1848302]
  • In addition , the expression level of the lsrACDBFG operon is much higher in wild-type cells than in the luxS mutant , as CRP is required for its activation ( 50 ) . [16321939]
  • In the wild-type background expression of the gntP-lacZ fusion was approximately 100-fold higher than in either the crp or cya mutants , indicating that cAMP and CRP are required for activation ( Table 2 ) . [15516583]
  • In order to test the involvement of different domains of CRP in PcspD activation , PcspD activity was studied in M182 crp cells complemented with different activation region mutant alleles of CRP . [24509317]

  • The class I activation mechanism that CRP utilizes when bound to CRP2 recruits RNAP via an interaction between the promoter proximal subunit of the CRP dimer and the polymerase R-CTD . [20000490]
  • The class II mechanism that CRP utilizes when bound to CRP1 also features this interaction , although in this case with the promoter distal subunit of bound CRP . [20000490]
  • The modesty of the activation is partly due to the activator-independent strength of the malI promoter , but principally it is because CRP site 1 is located 34 bp upstream of the 10 hexamer element , which is 2 bases upstream of the optimal position for Class II activation ( Busby & Ebright , 1999 ) . [19054084]
  • The CRP protein represses the P1 promoter under low osmotic growth conditions ; however , the effect of CRP on P2 activation has not been reported ( 33 , 58 ) . [10894725]

[11866515]

  • Role of CRP in activation of the melAB promoter The results from the in vitro studies reported above suggest that CRP interacts directly at the melAB promoter . [10760178]
  • The mechanism of CRP activation varies depending on where CRP binds relative to the promoter . [16166533]
  • The intrinsically defective lacP1 promoter requires CRP for activation of transcription both in vitro and in vivo ( 32 ) . [15385551]
  • The predominance of mutations affecting CRP is consistent with the central role of CRP in activation of the promoter ; CRP alone can stimulate the promoter both in vivo and in vitro , whereas AraC alone has no effect ( 29 ) . [1400237]
  • With the aI / aII mutant Es38 , Fis alone activated transcription 17-fold , similar to its effect on the wild-type enzyme , but in the presence of both Fis and CRP there was little or no increase in activation ( Figure 6 ( a ) , lanes 7 and 8 ) . [11866515]
  • Further , if these s70 residues are important for activation by RhaS in the absence of CRP , it is possible that other AraC / XylS family proteins that activate transcription without the aid of a second activator , such as CRP , may also require these residues . [10940041]
  • CRP and RhaR could each partially activate transcription in the absence of the other two activators , and a-CTD was not capable of activation alone . [11073923]
  • This in vitro transcription system mimics the in vivo activation of rhaBAD by RhaS-CTD and also , to a great extent , the in vivo activation of rhaBAD by full-length RhaS , each in the presence and absence of CRP . [17513476]
  • At the rhaSR promoter , the 70 L595A derivative was unique in that it was defective in both the presence and absence of the second activator , CRP , but it 's role in RhaR-mediated transcription activation is not yet known . [15342598]
  • Our results show that the pattern of cleavage is identical in both the absence and the presence of CRP , implying that CRP does not reposition s70 region 4 during transcription activation . [10781573]
  • CRP alone does not activate rhaBAD expression , but in the presence of RhaS CRP can contribute 30 - to 50-fold additional activation ( 10 ) . [10852886]
  • CRP activation at some promoters , such as melAB and araBAD , is dependent on the presence of an additional regulator ( MelR and AraC , respectively ) ( 33,25 ) that is only induced by a speciﬁc substrate . [15520470]
  • This smaller defect in the presence of CRP activation was not expected given the hypothesis that the primary role of a-CTD would be interaction with CRP . [10852886]

  • Comparison of transcripts synthesized by the - 235 and - WT enzymes in the absence and presence of CRP demonstrated that nearly all of the CRP-dependent activation of pSR depended on - CTD in the presence of RhaR . [16166533]
  • pSR activation by CRP was determined by dividing the intensity in the presence of CRP by the intensity in the absence of CRP for each pair of lanes ( intensity of pSR was corrected on the basis of the intensity for control p82 transcripts ) . [16166533]
  • The lack of sequence dependence for the CRP site in the ara region may also be because the araBAD operon , unlike the gal and lac operons , depends not just on CRP activation but also on activation by a specific activator , AraC . [2521619]
  • The contribution of DNA bending to transcriptional activation is more important when CRP is bound further upstream and protein-protein contacts are more difficult to establish . [8895588]
  • The requirement for Fis for activation by CRP could , at least in part , re ¯ ect the ability of Fis to bend DNA . [11866515]
  • The requirement of both RhaR and - CTD for signiﬁcant CRP activation of pSR suggests a possible mechanism by which RhaR bends DNA to allow CRP to interact with - CTD . [16166533]
  • The mechanism of CRP activation has been studied in detail and is believed to involve DNA bending , direct interaction with RNA polymerase ( Ebright , 1993 ; Ishihama , 1993 ; Kolb e t al. , 1993b ; West e t a / . [7551052]
  • The activation factors are smaller than for CRP either because additional interactions exist between the genuine activator CRP and RNA polymerase , or because the geometrical distortions introduced by IHF do not exactly mimic the DNA conformation induced by CRP . [8895588]
  • The mechanism by which RhaR increases CRP activation is not known , but it does not appear to be through cooperative binding on the basis of our DNase footprinting results ( Fig. 7 ) . [16166533]
  • The binding of MalT and CRP to this region is known to result in the formation of a higher-order structure that is responsible for malKp activation . [9000616]
  • The steep decrease of transcriptional activation when the CRP binding site is moved away from the -60.5 position ( Figure 4 ) . [8895588]
  • The decrease in transcriptional activation by CRP upon shifting the CRP binding site I bp away from the optimal position is indeed of this magnitude . [8895588]
  • The 287 determinant is required for activation by CRP but is not required for DNA binding or UP element-dependent activation . [10852886]
  • The mechanism of activation of pBAD by CRP apparently does not involve stimulation or stabilization of Arab binding to aral . [1848302]
  • The question however , is why CRP requires co-binding of CaiF for full activation . [10564497]
  • The position of the CRP site at rhaSR ( 111.5 ) is less typical , and in the tandem CRP site studies , CRP sites near this position made little , if any , contribution to activation ( 3 ) . [19854903]
  • The lower afﬁnity site , CRP II , centred at position -122.5 , is necessary for maximal activation . [14651625]
  • The contribution by CRP requires the correct helical phasing of the CRP site and a functional activation region 1 on CRP . [10894725]
  • The location of the CRP site at 2106.5 is therefore appropriate to permit CRP-dependent activation . [9852003]
  • The presence of this site was shown to be essential for PcspE activation by CRP . [21926233]
  • The full-length fusions include the binding site for CRP in addition to that for RhaS , indicating that in the presence of CRP the contribution of these residues to rhaBAD and rhaT activation was either decreased or eliminated . [10940041]
  • The threefold contribution to activation by CRP in this experiment is very similar to the twofold contribution found in the above in vivo experiment ( Table 3 ) , conﬁrming that RhaS-CTD is sufﬁcient to allow at least partial CRP activation of rhaBAD expression . [17513476]
  • The increased expression from the longer of these fusions is due to the contribution of CRP to the activation ( 15 , 34 ) , which in this case was nearly 100-fold in combination with RhaR but was less than fourfold in combination with RhaS . [19854903]
  • The following shows that CR ( P activation in viva is also dependent upon the distance and orientation between the CRP and aral sites . [1848302]
  • The data in Table 1 show that , like CRP-induced loop breaking , activation of peAD by CRP is dependent upon its orientation and distance from aral . [1848302]
  • The full level of activation that is seen with CRP and wild-type Fis is not achieved ; however , it is evident that the transcriptionally impaired Fis mutants are still competent for coactivation with CRP . [10894725]
  • The requirement for activating region 1 of CRP in PcspD activation , along with the involvement of the 287 , 265 , and 261 determinants of the - CTD , suggest that CRP activates by a class I-type mechanism . [24509317]
  • The small defect upon substitution of CRP G162 leaves open the possibility that CRP activation of rhaBAD could involve AR1 contacts with a-CTD ; however , the evidence for such an interaction is not strong . [10852886]
  • The magnitude of the synergistic effects was usually greater with just two activators than with all three , suggesting possible redundancies in the mechanisms of activation by CRP , a-CTD , and RhaR . [11073923]
  • The stabilizing effect of CRP is lost , suggesting that the R-subunits are involved in the CRP-mediated activation , most likely by a direct interaction . [8952481]
  • The activation factor Position CRP ( activation ) Position IHF ( inhibition ) Activation factors are given as the ratio of luminosities in wt strains compared with strains deleted for the activator ( CRP or IHF ) . [8895588]
  • The fact that Lrp and CRP are required for full activation of PgcvT [ 14,15 ] complicates interpretation of the results . [15621456]
  • The magnitude of IHF activation is smaller than the activation obtained with CRP bound at the same positions . [8895588]
  • The significance of this difference is easily understood in the context of the dual transcriptional activation mechanisms mediated by CRP . [20000490]
  • The allostery of CRP activation has been understood mainly in terms of conformational change . [19439203]
  • The rate-limiting step , therefore , in induction of the regulon be ara may activation by CRP . [181362]
  • 4 The strong CRP activation of dctA ensures that external C4-dicarboxylates are taken up for catabolic purposes only in the absence of `` more preferable '' carbon and energy sources , such as glucose . [10482502]
  • The - WT RNAP showed levels of activation by CRP and RhaR that were comparable to those obtained with RNAP puriﬁed as a holoenzyme ( Fig. 8 ) . [16166533]
  • The level of prpB mRNA in M9-glucose culture ( Fig. 6 , lanes 3 and 4 ) was lower than that in LB culture ( Fig. 6 , lanes 1 and 2 ) , in agreement with the involvement of CRP in activation of the prpBCDE operon ( 13 ) . [19633077]
  • When CRP represses at the ompA and cya promoters , it is bound outside of its activation position and within the common zone of repression ( Fig. 2 ) . [1943993]
  • This would necessarily lead to a two-step activation mechanism at both deoP2 and udpP : first , a relatively modest activation due to the initial recruitment of RNAP by CRP bound at CRP2 . [20000490]
  • This component of CRP activation at rhaSR could account for the majority of the CRP activation in a wild-type context and may involve a mechanism , such as DNA bending , that can act from a distance . [11073923]
  • If an interaction between CRP and a-CTD does occur at rhaSR , it appears to make a relatively small contribution to activation in the wild-type context . [11073923]
  • Gaston et al. ( 9 ) demonstrated that a DNA site for CRP located at 69.5 resulted in weak activation compared to the preferred 61.5 site . [12923087]
  • Nevertheless , in the case of deoP2 , if a-CTD ± UP-element interactions and a-CTD ± CRP interactions both recruit a-CTD to the DNA site , the activation system appears to be redundant . [11574471]
  • This smaller defect may indicate that CRP displaces a-CTD to a weaker DNA site , thereby reducing the ability of a-CTD to contribute to activation . [10852886]
  • In addition to the possible interaction between a-CTD and CRP , the alanine scan results indicate that DNA contacts by a-CTD are important for its activation . [11073923]
  • We wished to identify residues in a-CTD involved in this activation and to investigate whether a-CTD activation depends on interactions with DNA and/or CRP and / or RhaS . [10852886]
  • First , the only contribution of a-CTD to activation could be by interaction with DNA , and all of the activation signals that CRP and RhaS transmit to RNAP could be transmitted by a-CTD-in-dependent mechanisms . [10852886]
  • Overall , our results suggest that CRP interaction with a-CTD may not be required for rhaBAD activation ; however , a-CTD does contribute to full activation , probably through interactions with DNA and possibly RhaS . [10852886]
  • Overall , our results are most consistent with a model for rhaBAD activation in which CRP activates by a mechanism other than interaction with a-CTD and in which a-CTD activates by interacting with DNA and possibly RhaS . [10852886]
  • When supercoiled templates were used , the activation effect of DNA bending was about 1.6-fold for CRP and fourfold for IHF ( Fig. 5a ) . [16553838]
  • H159L When linear templates were used , the activation effect of DNA bending was about 25-fold for CRP ( Fig. 5a ) . [16553838]
  • Recall that for the sigma 70 activators OmpR and CRP , activation diminishes precipitously as the DNA elements are moved out of the nearby proximal position ( 40 , 81 ) . [1943993]
  • Removal of this DNA almost completely abolishes transcriptional activation by CRP in vitro ( 10 ) . [9256428]
  • In addition to the effect of CRP , activation of cai and ﬁx promoters has been shown to be subject to the essential function of CaiF , the speciﬁc activator of carnitine metabolism ( 11 ) . [9573142]
  • In contrast to activation , the repression levels of most operons were not signiﬁcantly affected by either HL159-CRP or KE101-CRP , which indicates that most CRP repression is not dependent on either the AR1 or the AR2 determinant . [15520470]
  • In addition , most CRP-dependent promoters are subjected to repression by other factors , which will mask the CRP activation in vivo . [15520470]
  • In this report , we further investigate the regulation of proP by examining the effects of CRP on transcriptional activation of the P2 promoter . [10894725]
  • In contrast , when the CRP box is located at 260.5 , efﬁcient activation is obtained with both holoenzymes . [11532138]
  • DISCUSSION In the past few years , genetic and biochemical experiments have identified a surface-exposed loop of CRP ( ARI ) that is involved in transcriptional activation . [8952481]
  • This deletion also removed CRP site 2 and hence our result conﬁrms that this site plays little or no role in CRP-dependent activation of the malX promoter . [19054084]
  • Therefore , similar to the wild-type promoter , PcspD with CRP site-I ( 83.5 ) alone also requires activation region 1 for CRP-dependent activation . [24509317]
  • In addition , the CRP molecule bound to site 1 seems to play a direct but so far undeﬁned role in the activation process . [9000616]
  • In addition to decreasing CRP activation of pSR , mutation of CRP site 3 also decreased the amount of the CRP A and CRP B transcripts . [16166533]
  • In the lac and gal systems , single base-pair changes in the CRP site may result in greatly decreased activation by CRP ( 5 , 8 ) . [2521619]
  • Our results demonstrated that CRP site 3 was most critical for CRP activation of pSR ( Fig. 5 ) , in agreement with the in vivo results . [16166533]
  • CRP activation was not affected by deletion of CRP site-II , whereas deletion of CRP site-I lead to complete loss of CRP-mediated activation of PcspD . [24509317]
  • Therefore , it can be concluded that CRP site-I plays an important functional role in CRP-mediated PcspD activation , while CRP site-II plays a minor role . [24509317]
  • As in the CRP studies , the activation is maximal when the OmpR sites are restricted to the same side of the helix as the natural site . [1943993]
  • CRP activation of pBAD in ciz ) o shows the same dependence on t , he distance and orientation of the CRP site relative to aral . [1848302]
  • It was found that CRP mediates activation of araC through this site . [2521619]
  • Partial deletion of CRP target site leads to loss of PcspE activation by CRP . [21926233]
  • Both mobility shift assay and mutagenesis results suggest that site 3 has a direct role in CRP activation of rhaSR ; thus we conclude that CRP bound at site 3 is required for full rhaSR activation . [11073923]
  • CRP bound to the lower-afﬁnity upstream CRP II site , however , may substitute for the UP element to enhance activation of P2 from the suboptimal 69.5 site . [12923087]
  • CRP utilizes a class I activation mechanism when bound to either CRP1 or distal CRP2 site ( 11-16 ) . [20000490]
  • Synergistic activation of a transcriptional-regulator together with CRP has been shown at several loci including the ara locus by AraC and CRP , malE by MalT and CRP , rha by RhaS / RhaR and CRP and asc by two CRP dimers , among others ( 37,44 -- 47 ) . [24335284]
  • We also dem-onstrate the role of CRP in the direct activation of the ulaAB-CDEF operon and show that ula regulon expression was not affected in an FNR mutant . [14996803]
  • We hypothesized that the residual FNR protein-indepen-dent expression of the CC fusion construct was due to activation by the CRP protein . [1629153]
  • As expression of rhaS is also dependent on CRP activation ( C. C. Holcroft and S. M. Egan , submitted for publication ) , it was possible that the small effects of the CRP AR1 and AR2 substitutions were indirect , due to decreased RhaS protein . [10852886]
  • However , the CRP contribution to rhaSR activation is substantially lower when RhaS is the primary activator than when RhaR is the primary activator , resulting in a relative decrease in rhaSR expression . [19854903]
  • However , the contribution to activation by CRP at the promoter activated by RhaS was greatly reduced compared with the CRP-RhaR combination , thereby resulting in a relative repression of rhaSR expression upon activation by RhaS . [19854903]
  • This suggested that CRP is important for activation of ClyA expression by SlyA . [11053378]
  • This suggests that CRP site 3 is responsible for at least part of the CRP activation of rhaSR expression . [11073923]
  • Although the single CRP site is involved in activation of both araBAD expression and araC expression , different mutations in the site did not affect expression to the same extent . [2521619]
  • Taken together , our results suggest that CRP site 3 is the major site required for CRP activation of rhaSR expression . [11073923]
  • Evidence is presented that CRP is directly involved in the expression of the cai and ﬁx genes and plays a crucial role in the activation of carnitine metabolism . [9573142]
  • We can deduce that the former group of deletions cause a reduction in both P1 and P2 expression , whilst the latter group prevents the activation of P1 by CRP and the switch from P2 to P1 . [6408264]
  • CRP activation of rhaBAD expression appears to occur by a mechanism other than interaction with a-CTD . [10852886]
  • To begin to understand the mechanism of CRP activation of rhaBAD expression , we wished to determine whether AR1 and/or AR2 of CRP are necessary for activation at rhaBAD . [10852886]
  • Since we now had evidence that CRP was a direct activator of rhaSR expression , we wished to determine whether AR1 and/or AR2 of CRP were necessary for this activation . [11073923]
  • In both cases , there is little or no activation by CRP in the absence of RhaS or RhaR ( Table 2 ) ( 16 ) ; presumably , CRP requires DNA bending by the primary activator to enable contacts with - CTD ( 8 ) . [19854903]
  • In the absence of both CRP and RhaR , a-CTD did not contribute any activation . [11073923]
  • Since there is no detectable rhaBAD activation by CRP in the absence of RhaS , it was not possible to test the effect of a-D235 expression on CRP activation independent of RhaS activation . [10852886]
  • We have some evidence that a-CTD activation , at least in the absence of CRP , may involve contacts with RhaS . [10852886]
  • As mentioned above , it was not possible to test the contribution of a-CTD to CRP activation in the absence of RhaS since CRP does not activate under such conditions . [10852886]
  • First , the fold activation by - CTD increased in a the absence of CRP [ compare the defects upon a-CTD deletion at F ( rhaB-lacZ ) D110 , 13-fold , and F ( rhaB-lacZ ) D84 , 54-fold ] . [10852886]
  • This is similar to the increased activation by 70 two of the s substitutions ( E591A and R596A ) when tested at araBAD in the absence of CRP ( 36 ) . [10940041]
  • This increased activation by CRP and a-CTD in the absence of the other is the opposite of what would be expected if CRP activation required contacts with a-CTD . [10852886]
  • This would represent the 4-fold activation by RhaR , and the 20-fold and 13-fold activation by CRP , in the absence of other activators . [11073923]
  • Effect of CRP AR1 and AR2 on activation Previous studies have shown that CRP activation is dependent on the interactions of its activating regions with subunits of RNAP [ reviewed in ( 3 ) ] . [15520470]
  • To test whether the - CTD was required for full activation by CRP or RhaR , we reconstituted RNAP from its individual subunits in order to obtain RNAP preparations in which both copies of the - CTD were deleted for all residues after amino acid 235 ( - 235 ) . [16166533]
  • We expected that CRP activation would involve contacts with - CTD ; hence , - CTD would be required a a for full activation . [10852886]
  • We next tested whether both or only one of the RhaS half-sites contribute to RhaS-CTD activation and whether RhaS-CTD is sufﬁcient to allow CRP to contribute to rhaBAD activation . [17513476]
  • We tested whether it would be possible to obtain increased CRP coactivation at rhaSR in combination with RhaS by screening for RhaS variants with increased activation at ( rhaS-lacZ ) 128 , but without any increase in activation at ( rhaS-lacZ ) 85 . [19854903]
  • We investigated the mechanism of CRP activation at rhaSR both alone and in combination with RhaR in vivo and in vitro . [16166533]
  • We found that RhaS-CTD allowed signiﬁcant activation by CRP , both in vivo and in vitro , although full-length RhaS allowed somewhat greater CRP activation . [17513476]
  • We also found that CRP , RhaR , and a-CTD each have synergistic effects on activation by the others , suggesting direct or indirect interactions among all three . [11073923]
  • We have no evidence at this time to argue either for or against a direct interaction between CRP and RhaR ; however , we do have some evidence to suggest that a direct a-CTD -- CRP interaction could contrib-ute to rhaSR activation . [11073923]
  • To distinguish between these two possible roles for CRP , the positive-control ( PC ) gcvA mutant gcvAF31A ( 16 ) was used to separate the activation and repression functions of GcvA . [10074087]
  • Thus , there may be nothing special about the involvement of CRP ; it may simply be that physiology has evolved to demand activation in addition to repression principally for catabolite-sensitive operons . [1943993]
  • Due to the dual action of GcvA , it is possible that CRP interferes with repression by GcvA or facilitates activation by GcvA , since both scenarios can explain the phenotypes of the Dcrp and the Dcrp DgcvA strains . [10074087]
  • For instance , the apparent repression by PdhR could be due to an interference of activation by another factor such as CRP . [17513468]
  • This was expected , since the CRP requirement for MelR-dependent activation of pmelAB is well established ( 31 ) . [16621812]

  • Much of our knowledge about transcription activation comes from studies of CRP and CRP homologs that can activate from either class I or class II positions .7 Despite the importance of transcription activation to an understanding of gene expression , little is known at a level of detail comparable to that for CRP family members about the mechanism of activation by other transcription factors . [11866514]
  • These observations may be explained by a mechanism in which FNR recognizes PhlyE efﬁciently but acts only as a relatively poor activator of hlyE transcription ( 10 , 11 ) , whereas , conversely , the recognition of PhlyE by CRP is poor , but once CRP is bound , CRP-mediated activation of hlyE expression is efﬁcient . [14996792]

  • In particular , the same s residues that affect FNR-dependent transcrip-70 tion activation ( K593 , R596 and K597 ) are also required for transcription activation by the related transcription factor CRP , under conditions that specifically use activating region 3 ( AR3 ) , one of three potential CRP activating regions . [11115116]
  • In addition , we have demonstrated that CRP can further stimulate rhaSR expression in vitro and have obtained evidence that CRP activation at rhaSR requires contact with - CTD . [16166533]
  • Tobin and Schleif ﬁrst demonstrated RhaR activation of rhaSR transcription in vitro ( 31 ) ; however , at that time it was not known that CRP also regulates rhaSR expression . [16166533]
  • In this study , both in vivo and in vitro transcription assay methods demonstrated that CRP site 3 was required for signiﬁcant transcription activation of rhaSR by CRP ( Fig. 2A and 5 ) . [16166533]

  • In vitro transcription results also indicated that CRP activation at rhaSR requires the - CTD of RNAP . [16166533]
  • This twofold activation ( which was lost in a strain carrying an ihfB deletion [ 8 ] ) suggests that DNA bending may make a small contribution to CRP activation of rhaSR transcription , but it is at most a small part of the approximately 100-fold activation by CRP at this promoter . [16166533]

  • Opposing activation and repression , mediated by CRP and a LacI family member , respectively , is one of the most common ways in which transcription of catabolic genes is regulated in bacteria to meet the cell 's metabolic needs . [20000490]
  • Fis activates proP P2 transcription predominantly through aII Co-activation with Fis and CRP requires both aCTDs We have previously shown that co-activation of proP P2 transcription by Fis and CRP is dependen on the aCTD .24,29 To determine whether Fis and CRP are each acting independently through different aCTDs , the oriented a-heterodimers were used in transcription reactions containing one or both activators ( Figure 6 ) . [11866515]
  • To determine the effect of this region on coactivation with CRP , in vitro transcription reactions were performed with CRP together with Fis mutants that by themselves are strongly defective in P2 activation . [10894725]
  • Single-round in vitro transcription reactions were performed with CRP and Fis mutants containing substitutions in the B-C loop region that is required for P2 activation by Fis . [10894725]
  • The hypothesis of a direct role of CRP sites 1 and 2 in the activation of transcription of cai and ﬁx , respectively , was tested by examining the effect of alterations in the two sites on expression of caiT-lacZ and ﬁxA-lacZ fusions . [9573142]
  • The three - to ﬁvefold activation of these mutant promoters by CRP can be ascribed to a repositioning of CRP2 from 93 to 71 bp from the transcriptional start , a position from which CRP activates transcription from the WT malT promoter ( 4 ) . [8626289]
  • The observed negative correlation between acetate formation and transcription of acs -- yjcH -- actP can be explained by CRP dependent activation as different glucose concentrations were present in the feed medium . [17273855]
  • CRP Repression Is CTD-dependent -- The interaction of CRP with the CTD of RNAP is the basis of transcription activation in wild-type lacP1 and the CRP-independent lacP1 variants mentioned above ( 10 , 25 ) . [15385551]
  • The more recent ﬁnding that other s70 substitutions at positions near R596 , especially K593A , signiﬁcantly reduce activation by AraC in the absence of CRP supports the hypothesis that wild-type AraC and s70 make an interaction that contributes to transcription activation ( 36 ) . [10940041]

  • a The goal of this work was to characterize rhaBAD transcription activation by CRP and a-CTD . [10852886]
  • The in vivo and in vitro transcription assays and the DNase footprinting assays show little or no role for CRP site 2 in rhaSR activation . [16166533]
  • The above results identify CRP site 3 as the most important site for activation of rhaSR transcription , but they do not provide information about the mechanism of activation by CRP bound at site 3 . [16166533]
  • The orientation in which MelR binds to site 2 and site 2 cents has important consequences , as it deﬁnes the surfaces of MelR that can make contact with the RNA polymerase s subunit and CRP during transcription activation . [12675795]

[12923087]
  • However , we propose that , although NarP and NarL bind as dimers , transcription activation requires activity in just one of the subunits of the dimer ( this has been shown for both CRP and FNR : Zhou etal . [7854119]
  • Although CRP sites appear from different distances upstream to cognate promoters , maximal activation is obtained when CRP is located at bp 261.5 or 241.5 upstream of the transcription start site ( reference 25 and citations therein ) . [8631699]
  • Site-directed mutagenesis of CRP sites 1 and 2 clearly demonstrated that site 1 is required to activate only transcription of the cai operon whereas site 2 only plays a role in the activation of the ﬁx operon . [9573142]
  • One of the most intriguing features of transcriptional activation by CRP is the observation that CRP can activate transcription when placed at many different positions upstream of the transcription start site . [8952481]
  • CRP site 3 therefore emerges as the critical CRP site for rhaSR transcription activation , consistent with our previous , less comprehensive , results obtained using multicopy fusions ( 15 ) . [16166533]
  • DISCUSSION CRP site 3 is critical for CRP activation of rhaSR transcription . [16166533]
  • Therefore , even though CRP and FNR share the same structural framework , there are major differences in the way they interact with CZCTD , such that different contacts are used to modulate the extent of transcription activation at specific promoters . [11407111]
  • A variation of CRP-dependent activation , designated class III , utilizes two or more CRP dimers or a combination of CRP and other activators to achieve maximal transcription activation ( reviewed in references 5 and 10 ) . [12923087]
  • CRP-dependent activation requires activating region I. Given the location of CRP I ( 69.5 ) and CRP II ( 122.5 ) , we predicted that CRP activates acs transcription by class I interactions . [12923087]
  • indicating strongly that CRP sites I and II are responsible for inhibition and activation of crp transcription , respectively . [1328816]
  • However , transcription of pap is independent of CRP activation in the E. coli K-12 mutant lacking H-NS ( 18 ) . [11053378]
  • Expression of the E. coli K-12 melAB genes , which encode products essential for melibiose metabolism , depends on transcription activation by MelR and CRP , and is triggered by melibiose ( 7,9 ) . [18346968]

  • A peculiar synergistic transcription activation of the mhp genes by the specific MhpR activator and the CRP global regulator is described . [12748194]
  • This tightly regulated system uses two transcription factors for its activation , MhpR and CRP , and maximizes the efficiency of activation by using two synergistic effectors for the same transcription factor . [19520845]

  • Results Glucose lowers the expression of crp on a multicopy plasmid We found recently that the presence of glucose in the culture medium lowers the CRP level 2 - to 3-fold in exponentially growing wild-type cells ( Ishizuka et al. , 1993 ) . [7518773]
  • It should be noted that in the presence of glucose the levels of CRP and crp mRNA in cya - cells are than those in cells significantly higher wild-type ( Figures 5 and 6 ) . [7518773]
  • The differences in AI-2 activity of cell-free ﬂuids from the wild type and crp and cya mutants grown with glucose ( data not shown ) were not as marked as the differences observed when cells were grown without glucose , probably due to the already very low level of cAMP and CRP in the cells in the presence of glucose . [15743955]

  • For example , it was shown previously that the intracellular concentration of CRP is lower in E. coli cells growing in the presence of glucose than in cells utilizing glycerol as a sole carbon source ( 37 ) . [19633076]
  • CRP Mediates a Superimposed Level of Regulation on the Pa Promoter -- It is known that some aromatic catabolic pathways in E. coli , such as the paa , hca , hpa , and mao-encoded pathways responsible for the catabolism of phenylacetate , phenylpropionate , 4-hydroxyphenylacetate , and 2-phenylethylamine , respectively , are repressed by the presence of glucose in the culture medium ( 26 , 27 , 42 -- 45 ) . [12748194]
  • For cells grown in a glucose-containing medium , the amount of the gapB P0 transcript was dramatically reduced in the absence of CRP ( compare lanes 1 and 2 in Fig. 3A ) , whereas the absence of CRP had no marked effect on the low level of gapB P0 mRNA in cells grown in a succinate-glycerol-containing medium ( compare lanes 3 and 4 in Fig. 3A ) . [9851989]

[8000525]

  • However , rather than the approximately eightfold enhancement in hlyE expression observed in an hns mutant on solid medium ( 36 ) , in liquid culture H-NS has a positive effect on CRP-driven hlyE expression , a negative effect on FNR-driven hlyE expression , and little intrinsic regulatory activity in the absence of FNR and CRP . [14996792]
  • The ﬁndings that SlyA does not enhance hlyE expression in hns cultures grown in liquid medium under anaerobic conditions and that SlyA appears unable to activate hlyE expression in the absence of FNR and CRP and the determination of the location of the region of PhlyE occupied by SlyA ( Fig. 6 ) suggest that SlyA activates hlyE expression by antagonizing the negative action of H-NS . [14996792]

  • The CRP protein is another global regulator that , on exhaustion of glucose or its analogues , switches the cellular metabo-lism to the utilization of alternative carbon sources , such as lactose , maltose , and arabinose ( 24 , 25 ) . [11279109]
  • The observations reported here have many notable features : in the deﬁned MOPS minimum medium with different carbon sources , CRP is activated in poor quality ( deﬁned by growth rate ) carbon sources relative to rich quality ones ; this activated CRP associates with the ﬂhDC operon encoding the master regulator with roles in ﬂagellar regulation and development ; the activation of CRP is correlated with the increase of expression of sF as well as the increase of cell motility .   • Key words : autoregulation/catabolite repression/CRP - cAMP/crp expression/transcriptional activation The inhibition of gene expression by glucose in culture medium has been a paradigm for understanding how genes are regulated in response to nutrient status in bacteria . [7518773]

  • Type III promoters , such as araBAD ( 48 ) , malE , and malK ( 52 ) , require the coordinate function of CRP , usually bound at upstream sequences , and one or more additional activators , usually bound between CRP and RNA polymerase . [1400237]
  • A direct contact between CRP and RNA polymerase could be more difficult to establish due to the increased distance between the proteins . [8895588]
  • CRP activates guaP and represses xseP when cells are placed under nutrient-limited conditions , presumably to remove competition for RNA polymerase between the closely-spaced promoters . [10856643]
  • Under these conditions RNA polymerase can successfully compete with CRP to form transcriptionally active complexes . [10601034]

  • For example , CRP is considerably larger than Fis , and aCTD binds approximately one turn of the helix downstream of the promoter-proximal CRP subunit in the CRP-aCTD-DNA complex .28 Furthermore , the regions on CRP ( AR1 ) and Fis ( the B-C turn ) that interact with aCTD are positioned differently with respect to the bound DNA : the Fis B-C turn is immediately adjacent to and in line with the path of the DNA ,17 while CRP AR1 is further away from the DNA and off to one side .47 Therefore , in the complex with CRP , aCTD is not subject to the constraints that appear to alter its mode of DNA binding in the Fis complex , and it interacts with DNA in the same manner in which it interacts with the UP element ( Benoff , B. , Yang , H. , Lawson , C. , Ebright , Y. , Ebright , R. & Berman , H. , unpublished results ) A model for aCTD-Fis-DNA interactions in the rrnB P1 activation complex Materials and Methods Strains and plasmids Table 1 lists the strains and plasmids used in this work . [11866514]

  • CRP is not needed for MelR-dependent repression of the melR promoter To investigate the possibility that the activator CRP is required for repression of the melR promoter by MelR , we constructed derivatives of the TB20 fragment carrying mutations that inactivated either or both DNA sites for CRP , and measured MelR-dependent repression ( Figure 5A ) . [18346968]

  • These results demonstrate that propionate metabolism is subject to catabolite repression by the global transcriptional-regulator CRP and that this regulation is effected through control of both the regulator gene prpR and the prpBCDE operon itself . [15805526]

  • However , we found no stimulatory effect of CRP on metE-lacZ expression ; in fact , a crp deletion mutation in GS162 results in a threefold increase in metE-lacZ expression compared with the crp1 lysogen ( data not shown ) . [7836282]
  • These findings suggest that CRP functions in certain contexts to regulate gene expression in response to osmotic changes , in addition to its role in catabolite control . [10601034]
  • In addition , GcvA is known to require the gcvR gene product for its role as a repressor ( 12 ) , raising the possibilities that CRP also regulates expression of gcvR and indirectly alters gcvT-lacZ expression . [10074087]
  • In addition to this role , CRP also regulates gene expression in response to osmotic changes [ 40 ] . [16814929]
  • As CRP is not known to regulate hns expression or H-NS production , this suggests that CRP might exert its effect indirectly through another regulator that may act as a potential competitor of H-NS in regulation of expression of these ﬁmbriae . [20345943]
  • To determine if one or more of CRP 's three activating regions may be involved in the regulation of gcv , four CRP mutants were tested for their ability to complement the crp deletion and restore expression of gcvT-lacZ . [10074087]

  • However , clear glucose and CRP effects on dcuB expression were observed in the studies reported here , although the CRP effect was relatively weak . [9852003]
  • To test this hypothesis , we added pHA7 * to the malT-lacZ fusion strains to see if excess active CRP levels would restore the levels of MalT expression . [9829919]
  • These data suggested that hlyE expression is activated by FNR and CRP , repressed by H-NS , and that H-NS-mediated transcriptional silencing is relieved by SlyA . [17892462]
  • Thus , in complete contrast to the observed catabolite sensitivity of ODH synthesis , suc expression appears to be repressed rather than activated by CRP . [9720032]
  • Thus , the majority of the effects of CRP and FIS on gene expression are probably exerted under different growth conditions . [11279109]
  • Such cross-talk between FIS and CRP could provide selective advantage by allowing flexibility of transcriptional control and also increasing the precision of the coordination of cellular gene expression with changing growth conditions . [11279109]
  • Activation by CRP is absolutely dependent on AR1 since expression is abolished by CRP HL159 , but is restored by CRP HL159/KN52 ( data not shown ) . [8748035]
  • These ﬁndings suggested that comC expression is modulated by the global regulators RpoE and CRP , in addition to the copper-dependent regulation by ComR shown here . [22089859]
  • However , when the downstream activator is CRP , then expression of FF-CC is observed with CRP alone ; that is , it is not co-dependent . [8748035]
  • It is necessary to have both MalT and the mutated form of CRP ( CRP * ) to induce mal gene expression in sfsl-dependent systems . [2013578]
  • However , CRP was shown to appear to act as a repressor [ 21 ] in the expression of the adenylate cyclase gene , cya . [8018734]
  • Thus , CRP and FNR positively control cai expression and H-NS exerts a negative control . [9573142]
  • Thus , we suggest that the formation of different H-NS -- PhlyE complexes offers the opportunity for H-NS , in combination with FNR and CRP , to control hlyE expression both positively and negatively . [14996792]
  • Evidently , CRP , and not FNR , was required for the expression of ClyA in hns mutants under anoxic conditions , although it appeared that FNR could partly complement CRP . [11053378]
  • Involvement of both CRP and FNR in regulation of clyA expression during anaerobic-growth conditions . [11053378]
  • Thus , we concluded that CRP , FNR , and H-NS all contribute towards the regulation of hlyE expression . [14996792]

  • After induction of CRP expression by adding various concentrations of arabinose , b-galactosidase activity was measured . [24814025]
  • It is possible that expression of aer and trg is required only in response to conditions that induce CRP activity and not in response to other signals that induce the ﬂagellar cascade . [19843224]
  • Alternatively , expression of aer and trg may need to be upregulated to a greater extent than other genes when CRP activity is induced . [19843224]
  • It has been shown that the three proteins ChbR , CRP and NagC regulate the expression of the chb operon . [18028317]
  • A possible explanation for CRP 's dependence on GcvA is that CRP regulates expression of the gcvA gene and indirectly affects expression of gcvT-lacZ . [10074087]
  • CRP requires the repressor function of GcvA to regulate gcvT-lacZ expression . [10074087]
  • This feature accounts for the unusual effectiveness of CRP to activate expression of cytidine deaminase . [20000490]
  • This suggested that CRP might repress gadA and gadBC indirectly by regulating gadX expression . [12446650]
  • Second , CRP could indirectly regulate gyrA expression by means of a positive regulator directly controlled by CRP . [8655515]
  • Finally , CRP could regulate the expression of other topoisomerase genes . [8655515]

  • Location of RNA polymerase a C-terminal domains at the aer promoter Activation by CRP at both Class I and Class II s70-dependent promoters requires a contact between CRP activating region 1 ( AR1 ) and aCTD . [19843224]
  • CRP binds at position -41.5 and overlaps what in many promoters would be the -35 contact region for RNA polymerase . [1400237]
  • At Class I promoters , CRP binds upstream of the promoter 35 element and a single activation region ( AR1 ) makes contact with RNA polymerase . [17608696]
  • Given the promoter geometry and a wealth of genetic and biochemical data ( 16 -- 20 ) , the 260 signal most likely arises from a direct contact between the downstream subunit of CRP and RNA polymerase ( 21 ) , more specifically between activating region 1 of CRP and the carboxyl-terminal domain of the a-subunit of RNA polymerase ( 22 -- 25 ) . [9256428]
  • At Class I promoters , CRP binds upstream of the promoter -35 element , at a site centred at position -61.5 ( i.e. between base pairs 61 and 62 upstream from the transcript start ) , or further upstream , and an activating region ( AR1 ) in the downstream subunit of the CRP dimer makes contact with the C-terminal domain of one of the two RNA polymerase a subunits ( aCTD ) . [19843224]
  • AR1 in the upstream subunit of the CRP dimer interacts with aCTD , while a second activating region ( AR2 ) in the downstream subunit interacts with the N-terminal domain of one of the two RNA polymerase a subunits ( aNTD ) ( Busby and Ebright , 1999 ) . [19843224]
  • AR1 in CRP is mapped by amino acid residues T158 and H159 and is required at all Class I promoters and , to varying extents , at Class II promoters ( Bell et al. , 1990b ; West et aL , 1993 ; Zhou et aL , 1993a , 1994b ) ; it interacts with a contact site in the C-terminal domain of the alpha subunit of RNA polymerase ( see Ishihama , 1992 ; Ebright , 1993 ) . [8748035]
  • Likewise , mutants of RNA polymerase subunits have been used to establish that the C-terminal domain of the alpha ( a ) - subunit is the target for activation from class I promoters and both the oc - and sigma ( a ) - subunits interact with CRP at class II promoters ( Zou et al. , 1992 ; Ishihama , 1993 ) . [8895588]

  • Conclusions Here we have described the ﬁrst examples of direct activation by CRP of promoters served by RNA polymerase holoenzyme containing the ﬂagellar sigma factor , s28 . [19843224]
  • The direct contact between CRP and RNA polymerase therefore does not appear to contribute to transcriptional activation at the malT promoter . [9256428]
  • Thus , the nucleoprotein complex responsible for activation from -63 appears to be distinct from the activation complex of the -60.5 promoter ( possibly the opposite face of CRP making contact with the RNA polymerase , see Discussion ) . [8895588]
  • This resembles the position of a cAMP-CRP binding region of the E. coli lac promoter , - 61.5 ( 47 , 51 ) , which was found to be one of two ( the other being at - 41.5 ) that are optimal for the contact of CRP with RNA polymerase that is required for CRP-mediated transcription-activation ( 20 ) . [7906689]
  • The interaction between CRP and RNA polymerase has been shown to play a critical role in the activation of transcription in CRP-dependent promoters ( 6 , 18 ) . [10074084]
  • The orientation in which MelR binds to site 2 and site 2 cents has important consequences , as it deﬁnes the surfaces of MelR that can make contact with the RNA polymerase s subunit and CRP during transcription-activation . [12675795]
  • P1 activation depends on protein-protein contact between the RNA polymerase a subunit and CRP ( 13,19 , also reviewed in 20 ) , while P2 transcription is repressed by CRP binding ( Fig. 6 , lanes 3 and 4 ) . [7708499]
  • Protein-protein interactions involving opposing negatively and positively charged residues have frequently been reported and have recently been described for CRP and RNA polymerase ( 16 ) . [9324270]
  • A very long stretch of amino acids in a completely extended conformation would be necessary to explain almost equal activation factors when CRP is placed at -60 or -80 solely on the basis of identical protein-protein interactions between CRP and RNA polymerase . [8895588]
  • It is known that at CRP-dependent promoters CRP activates transcription by making direct protein -- protein contacts with the RNAP . [20966094]
  • At the malT promoter , closed complex formation is efficient and CRP primarily stimulates promoter escape through backside contacts with RNA polymerase and/or by destabilizing RNA polymerase-promoter interactions that impede escape ( e.g. interactions between the ct-subunit and DNA just upstream of -35 ) . [8895588]
  • These could either be contacts to RNA polymer-ase itself or CRP induced changes in DNA structure providing an improved contact surface for polymerase to bind . [3907860]
  • This protein should bend the DNA to a similar degree as does CRP ( Kosturko et al. , 1988 ) without making the exact same proteinprotein contacts with RNA polymerase . [8895588]
  • Because the only detectable interactions between CRP and RNA polymerase at this stage of the reaction are direct contacts , we propose that these contacts improve the rate of isomerization . [9256428]
  • At class II promoters , transcriptional activation is due almost exclusively to favour-able protein-protein contacts between different RNA polymerase subunits and CRP . [8895588]
  • Once bound , the predominant method of activation by CRP appears to be through protein contacts with RNA polymerase ( RNAP ) . [11073923]
  • At some locations the mechanism of activation involves direct protein-protein contacts between CRP and the RNA polymerase . [8895588]
  • Alternatively , CRP could act through specific protein-protein contacts with either MalT or the RNA polymerase holoenzyme . [2538630]
  • We conclude that the protein-protein contacts between CRP and RNA polymerase are rather rigid . [8895588]
  • Direct protein -- protein contacts between CRP and the RNA polymerase appeared very rapidly , followed by DNA melting around the 210 hexamer . [9256428]
  • Once bound to DNA , CRP makes protein -- protein contacts with RNA polymerase and recruits it to promoters to initiate transcription . [17068078]
  • Although we have argued that some element in the sequence from - 4 5 to - 5 6 is necessary for stable CRP binding , we can not exclude the possibility that RNA polymerase also makes contacts in this zone that are essential to stabilize the open complex at P1 . [6408264]
  • This demonstrates that , in both cases , AR1 in CRP is responsible for direct interaction with RNA polymerase . [10564497]
  • In this case it is possible that the system that we have used , where the repression loop can not be destabilised by CRP or RNA polymerase binding , allows such a weak interaction to be detected . [10982882]
  • In the case of CRP , this suggests that this activation involves neither an a-CTD interaction nor cooperative binding with RhaR , while in the case of RhaR , this suggests the likelihood of direct interactions with core RNA polymerase . [11073923]
  • It is currently not ` known whether activation requires a protein-protein interaction between the CRP and RNA polymerase or cAMP-CRP acts at a distance by changing the structure of the DNA near its binding site . [6377308]
  • The mechanism of transcription-activation appears to rely entirely on contacts between the DNA upstream of the CRP binding site and the back of RNA polymerase . [9256428]
  • Such protein-protein contacts depend on a precise spatial alignment of the components ; generally , we find strong peaks of activation whenever the CRP binding site is in the correct helical phase with respect to RNA polymerase ( Figure 4 ) . [8895588]
  • In araFGH and several other systems , the CRP binding site appears to be positioned so that CRP could make direct contact with RNA polymerase . [2231717]
  • At PFGH , CRP bends the DNA and , based on the overlap in binding sites , direct contact with RNA polymerase may occur within or near to the DNA-binding domain . [2231717]
  • On the other hand AraC protein could easily make direct contact with polymerase at araE and araBAD , but CRP might obstruct contact in the araFGH promoter . [2231717]
  • RNA-Polymerase-CPR-PromoterComplex-In terms of protein DNA backbone phosphate contacts , the RNA-polym-erase-CRP-promoter initiation complex shows a striking resemblance to the CytR-CRP repression complex in the -30 to -65 region . [8394345]
  • Without this DNA bend , AraC protein alone can not contact polymerase ; however , , the combined bending caused by CRP and AraC protein ( unpublished results ) may allow AraC directly to contact a second region of polymerase and further stimulate its activity . [2231717]
  • AraC contacts polymerase at a position similar to that of CRP at PFGH , and a DNA bend is produced that allows CRP to contact polymerase at the second region to provide additional stimulation . [2231717]
  • For example , the glycerol reaction contained three times as much Amp RNA as the CAMP-CRP reaction . [7023696]

  • In this case , activating region 1 ( AR1 ) of the downstream monomer of CRP contacts the RNAP - CTD to recruit RNAP to the promoter and activate transcription ( reviewed in reference 9 ) . [16166533]
  • In this situation , contacts are made between a second activating region on CRP , AR2 , and the N-terminal domain of a ( a-NTD ) ( 21 , 27 , 29 ; reviewed in references 5 and 6 ) , as well as between CRP AR1 and a-CTD ( 32 , 36 ) . [10852886]
  • To activate class II promoters , where CRP binds immediately adjacent to RNAP , CRP AR2 is necessary for positive interactions with the amino-terminal domain of the a subunit ( 21 , 27 , 30 ) ( reviewed in reference 5 ) . [11073923]
  • CRP AR2 is proposed to interact with the a subunit Nterminal domain at class II CRP-dependent promoters ( 21 ) . [10852886]
  • The interaction at class II CRP-dependent promoters also involves interaction between a second region , called AR2 , of CRP ( H19 , H21 , E96 , and K101 ) and the N-terminal domain ( - NTD ) of the RNAP subunit ( 21 ) . [21926233]
  • Activating region 1 ( AR1 ) of CRP , composed of amino acid residues 156 to 164 , interacts with a speciﬁc surface determinant , 287 , from the C-terminal domain of the alpha subunit ( - CTD ) of RNAP in both class I and class II promoters ( 21 ) . [21926233]
  • At class I CRP-dependent promoters , homodimeric CRP binds DNA sites centered near positions 61.5 , 71.5 , 82.5 , and 92.5 with respect to the transcription start site , and the downstream CRP monomer stimulates transcription by contacting the C-ter-minal domain of the RNAP subunit ( CTD ) through a surface-exposed loop known as activating region 1 ( AR1 ; residues 156 to 164 ) . [19633076]
  • At these promoters , CRP activates transcription by interacting with the C-terminal domain of the RNAP a subunit ( aCTD ) via a surface-exposed patch , known as activating region 1 ( AR1 ) ( residues 156 -- 164 ) . [15520470]
  • At these promoters , CRP makes multiple interactions with RNAP , including between AR1 and aCTD , the activating region 2 ( AR2 ) ( residues 19 , 21 and 101 ) and the N-terminal domain of a subunit ( aNTD ) and between AR3 ( residues 52 -- 58 ) and the RNAP s70 subunit region 4 . [15520470]
  • CRP activation at class I promoters involves proteinprotein contacts between a surface-exposed loop on CRP activating region 1 ( AR1 ) , and the carboxyl-terminal domain of the subunit ( - CTD ) of RNAP ( 31 , 35 , 36 ; reviewed in a a reference 6 ) . [10852886]
  • CRP AR1 is necessary for activation at class I CRP-depen-dent promoters , where CRP binds upstream and not adjacent to RNAP , and interacts with a deﬁned set of amino acids on the carboxyl-terminal domain of the RNAP a subunit ( a-CTD ) ( 33 , 38 , 39 ) ( reviewed in reference 8 ) . [11073923]
  • When CRP binds to these sites , its activating region 1 ( AR1 ) contacts RNAP 's a subunit C-terminal domain ( aCTD ) to recruit RNAP to the promoter . [17068078]
  • A class I mechanism refers to interactions between CRP and the C-terminal domain of the R-subunit ( RCTD ) of RNAP that serve to recruit RNAP to the promoter . [20000490]
  • CRP bound at any of these positions uses a deﬁned surface ( activating region 1 [ AR1 ] ) in the downstream subunit of CRP to contact a speciﬁc surface determinant ( 287 ) of the C-terminal domain of the - subunit of RNAP ( - CTD ; gray double oval ) . [15755952]
  • When bound at this position , CRP uses AR1 of the upstream subunit of CRP to contact the 287 determinant of the - CTD and a second sur - face ( AR2 ) to contact the 162 to 165 determinant of the N - terminal domain of . [12923087]
  • CRP uses a second surface ( AR2 ) of the downstream subunit to contact the 162-165 determinant of the N-terminal domain of . [15755952]
  • When bound at a class I promoter ( at some distance upstream of the promoter 235 region , as for the lac promoter ) , the CRP dimer makes a single contact with RNAP by using residues in a solvent-ex-posed loop known as activating region 1 ( AR1 ) in the promot-er-proximal subunit to contact the C-terminal domain of the a subunit ( a-CTD ) ( Fig. 3 ) ( reviewed in reference 4 ) . [10601201]
  • When bound at a class II promoter , wild-type CRP makes two contacts with RNAP by using AR1 in the promoter-distal subunit to contact the a-CTD and AR2 ( small black rectangle ) in the promoter-proximal subunit to contact the a-NTD . [10601201]
  • However , when bound at a class II promoter ( immediately adjacent to the promoter 235 region , as for the gal promoter ) , wild-type CRP makes two productive contacts with RNAP ( 17 ) ( Fig. 3 ) : ( i ) it uses a second activating region ( AR2 ) in the promoterproximal subunit to contact the N-terminal domain of the a subunit ( a-NTD ) and ( ii ) it uses AR1 in the promoter-distal subunit to contact the a-CTD ( which in turn associates with the DNA upstream of the DNA-bound CRP dimer ) . [10601201]
  • To deter mine if CRP is contacting the a-CTD at proP , we mapped the binding position on the proP promoter of a truncated a subunit containing only the last 85 amino acids comprising the Cterminal domain ( 20 ) by DNase I footprinting . [10894725]
  • This subunit consists of an N-terminal domain ( a-NTD ) containing determinants for interaction with the remainder of RNP and with CRP , a C-terminal domain ( a-CTD ) containing determinants for interaction-with-DNA and with various activators , and an unstructured / ¯ exible linker connecting the two subdomains ( Blatter et al. , 1994 ; Negishi et al. , 1995 ; Jeon et al. , 1997 ; Meng et al. , 2000 ) . [11574471]

  • Our studies show that both domains of MelR are involved in cooperative interactions ; the C-terminal domain in interactions with CRP , while the N-terminal domain is required for interactions between MelR proteins . [12060687]
  • Current understanding on the allosteric process of the Escherichia coli CRP activation can be summarized into a rigid-body movement that involves subunit realignment and domain rearrangement . [19439203]

[16166533]

  • A replacement of GC by AT at position - 4 5 resulted in the creation of a cAMP-CRP-independent promoter around position - 3 5 , whereas a deoP2 promoter containing three transitions at positions - 3 6 , - 8 9 and - 9 8 exhibited the same low activity as deoP2-wt in a strain that does not contain the CRP protein . [1661372]

[11574471]
  • We found that alanine substitution of some residues within both AR1 and AR2 of CRP resulted in small defects in rhaBAD activation . [10852886]
  • However , it is possible that amino acids in or near AR2 interact with other proteins involved in rhaBAD activation or , as mentioned above , that these substitutions have a small effect on the stability or overall structure of CRP . [10852886]
  • None of the AR1 nor AR2 mutants were signiﬁcantly defective for activation at F ( rhaS-lacZ ) D216 ( Table 6 ) , suggesting that the surface resi-dues on CRP that are most important for activation at simple CRP-dependent promoters may not have a signiﬁcant role in this context . [11073923]
  • This was further substantiated by our data demonstrating the involvement of the AR1 domain of CRP in PcspE transcription . [21926233]
  • In vivo , PcspE activity required only the AR1 domain of CRP ( Fig. 4B ) , and the improved AR3 domain did not compensate for the defective AR1 domain for PcspE activation ( Fig. 4C ) . [21926233]
  • These results indicate that the AR1 domain of CRP is critical for PcspD activation , whereas AR2 domain of CRP is not necessary . [24509317]
  • These results indicate that the AR1 domain of CRP , not the AR2 domain , is critical for PcspE activation , while an improved AR3 domain did not contribute to the activation . [21926233]
  • Site-directed mutagenesis experiments indicated that previously reported perfect CRP motif 1 , centered at 241.5 of the cai transcriptional start site , plays a direct role in the sole cai activation . [9573142]
  • Further evidence that transcriptional activation does not rely solely on protein-protein interactions comes from experiments using pc-mutants of CRP . [8895588]
  • Our results suggest that DNA topology and direct protein-protein contacts contribute to a comparable degree to the process of transcriptional activation by CRP at the malT promoter . [8895588]
  • Even though direct protein-protein contacts certainly participate in transcriptional activation by CRP , DNA bending may provide a major contribution at certain promoters . [8895588]
  • This region of s is located in the C-terminal 70 domain ( CTD ; amino acids 590 ± 613 ) , which also contains residues required for transcription-activation by Ada ( Landini and Busby , 1999 ) , lcI ( Kuldell and Hochschild , 1994 ; Li et al. , 1994 ) , AraC ( Hu and Gross , 1985 ) , RhaS ( Bhende and Egan , 2000 ) and the cyclic AMP receptor protein ( CRP ) ( Lonetto et al. , 1998 ) . [11115116]
  • With CRP , two interactions affect different steps in transcription initiation , namely an anti-inhibition component that overcomes the inhibitory effects of an untethered ~ CTD and a direct activation component that facilitates the transition from closed to open complexes ( Busby and Ebright , 1997 ) . [11407111]
