  • Thus , it was proposed that during exponential growth , Fis represses acs expression indirectly by repressing crp transcription and directly by binding to sites that overlap the binding sites of CRP and the -10 hexamer of RNAP . [17233826]
  • If this were the case , the disruption of the CRP binding site II , which is located upstream of the crp promoter and responsible for the activation of crp transcription by CRP-cAMP ( Hanamura and Aiba , 1992 ) , should lower the expression of crp in the absence of glucose and eliminate the down-regulation of crp by glucose . [7518773]
  • The promoter driving lacZ expression in this strain extends to − 84 ( in all cases , relative to the transcription start site ) and does not include the CRP binding site upstream of rhaBAD . [18366439]
  • It is unlikely that CRP binding to site 4 contributes directly to an increase in rhaSR expression , since transcription activation by CRP requires that its binding site be on the same face of the DNA as the promoter ( 6 ) . [11073923]
  • A single CRP binding site is located 2115.5 and 2215.5 bp upstream of the divergent transcription start sites for the papI and papB genes , respectively , and CRP positively regulates expression of these genes by inhibiting binding of the repressing H-NS protein ( 8 ) . [10074087]
  • Two members of the CRP family of transcription factors control the expression of hlyE in E. coli K-12 by binding at the same site centered at 61.5 bp upstream of the hlyE transcriptional start ( 10 , 36 ) . [14996792]
  • Previous work has shown that the global transcription factors FNR and CRP positively regulate hlyE expression by binding at the same site . [14996792]
  • Footprinting studies have shown that FNR and CRP activate hlyE expression from the same site centered 61.5 bp upstream of the SlyA-associated transcription start site ( 10 , 36 ) . [14996792]
  • Since cAMP-CRP is a negative transcription factor for Spot 42 production ( 30 ) , the data from this study suggest that any external or internal changes that evoke cAMP increase would not only promote the well-established notion of gal transcription initiation but also exert effects on expression of galK only through mK2 production independently from transcription initiation and from natural polarity . [24794565]
  • Our studies suggest that neither CRP nor ArcA is this transcription factor even though a previous study indicated that expression of fnr is slightly higher ( approximately twofold ) in ArcA cells under microaerobic growth conditions ( 49 ) . [17293415]
  • Tobin and Schleif ﬁrst demonstrated RhaR activation of rhaSR transcription in vitro ( 31 ) ; however , at that time it was not known that CRP also regulates rhaSR expression . [16166533]
  • Interestingly , the transcription of glpF and glpK is regulated by CRP and GlpR , whereas the expression of glpD is regulated by CRP , GlpR and ArcA , as proposed elsewhere [ 1,5 ] . [22513097]
  • We then measured the transcriptional levels of two well-known CRP positively controlled genes ( cstA and cpdB ) ( to represent the level of active CRP in the cell ) as well as the expression level of ﬂhDC operon by the quantitative RT-PCR approaches ( Figure 5B and C ) . [17576668]
  • While CRP activates the expression of both genes , the FIS protein positively regulates the hupA gene but negatively regulates the tandem P2-P3 promoters of hupB gene . [9367749]
  • CRP modulates positively or negatively the expression of a large number of genes and operons in response to glucose depletion ( 9 , 18 ) . [8655515]
  • Thus , CRP enhances hlyE expression in response to glucose starvation ( 36 ) and FNR enhances hlyE expression in response to oxygen starvation ( 10 , 11 , 23 ) . [14996792]
  • In summary , the data presented here suggest that FNR and CRP are positive regulators of hlyE expression in liquid culture in response to oxygen and glucose starvation , respectively . [14996792]
  • The data revealed that both FNR and CRP made signiﬁcant positive contributions to hlyE expression , whereas the hns mutation resulted in slightly reduced hlyE transcription under these conditions ( Fig. 1a ) . [14996792]
  • The ﬁndings that SlyA does not enhance hlyE expression in hns cultures grown in liquid medium under anaerobic conditions and that SlyA appears unable to activate hlyE expression in the absence of FNR and CRP and the determination of the location of the region of PhlyE occupied by SlyA ( Fig. 6 ) suggest that SlyA activates hlyE expression by antagonizing the negative action of H-NS . [14996792]
  • Previous in vivo experiments also indicate that CRP is not capable of activating rhaBAD expression in the absence of RhaS ( 11 ) , perhaps suggesting that RhaS must bend the DNA to allow CRP to activate , although other possibilities exist as well . [17513476]
  • We found that CRP alone was not capable of activating rhaBAD expression , similar to previous ﬁndings in vivo , and that His6-RhaS-CTD alone substantially activated rhaBAD expression ( Fig. 6 ) . [17513476]
  • This is in striking contrast to the action of CRP , which plays a direct role in the promoters of the cai and ﬁx operons ( Fig. 4 and 5 ) , in addition to modulating caiF expression ( 11 ) . [9573142]
  • As reported previously , expression of gadX is principally driven by the RpoS sigma factor ( Fig. 7D , stationary phase ) , and it is known that CRP represses rpoS expression ( Fig. 7C , exponential phase ) ( 10 , 20 ) . [12446650]

  • Like rpoH , the rotA gene contains multiple start sites for transcription , is under multiple control and its expression is ﬁne tuned by CytR/CRP ( Nørregaard-Madsen et al. , 1994 ; Pogliano et al. , 1997 ) . [9767576]
  • Not all CRP-bound sites control gene expression ( 9 ) , and it ha been proposed that CRP can act as a chromosome-compacting protein due to its ability to bend DNA ( 6 ) . [21460078]
  • A CRP binding-site mutation or the absence of a functional crp gene leads to high constitutive expression of P1 . [9079929]
  • None of the substitutions in the CRP sites had signiﬁcant effects on reporter gene expression in crp deletion strains , demonstrating that these DNA sequence changes did not alter expression in the absence of CRP . [16166533]
  • The crp * l gene encodes an altered cAMP receptor protein ( CRP * ) which is functional in the expression of some sugar fermentation genes , such as lac , ara , and man , in the absence of cAMP ( 3 ) . [2670911]
  • For expression and puriﬁcation of CRP protein , the 633-bp crp gene was ampliﬁed in our laboratory using primers crpF and crpR by PCR . [21840983]
  • In the absence of FIS , CRP activates fis tra-nscription , thereby displacing the polymerase from the divergent promoter , whereas together FIS and CRP synergistically repress fis gene expression . [11279109]
  • In addition , the mutation also results in elevated gcvA-lacZ expression in the presence and absence of CRP ( Table 6 ) and presumably of the gcvA gene itself . [10074087]
  • A possible explanation for CRP 's dependence on GcvA is that CRP regulates expression of the gcvA gene and indirectly affects expression of gcvT-lacZ . [10074087]
  • In addition , GcvA is known to require the gcvR gene product for its role as a repressor ( 12 ) , raising the possibilities that CRP also regulates expression of gcvR and indirectly alters gcvT-lacZ expression . [10074087]
  • The fact that hupB-P2 expression is not affected by CRP certainly explains why FIS expression of hupB-P2 is effective in the presence or absence of CRP ( Table 1 ) . [8913296]
  • In the absence of added sugars , CRP indeed appeared to be an activator of sfm both in the presence and in the absence of H-NS , as shown by decreased sfm expression in crp mutants ( Fig. 6 ) . [20345943]
  • The results using lacZ fusions showed no signiﬁcant difference in expression between crp + and crp constructs , indicating that CRP is not involved in the expression of gadE during growth on glucose ( data not shown ) . [19220752]
  • The positive-control CRP mutants T158A , H159L ( 49 ) ( Table 2 ) , and G162C ( 15 ) ( data not shown ) were also active in repressing P1 expression . [9079929]
  • H159L As control , the expression of native glnAp2 was not affected by the presence of either CRP or IHF ( data not shown ) . [16553838]
  • A crp mutation increases the basal level of setA - lacZ activity ( Fig. 4A and B ) , but not the activity of sgrS - lacZ , suggesting there may be another promoter controlling setA expression that is repressed by CRP . [20971900]
  • Finally , the third line of data shows an important control ; expression in every case is minimal in the absence of MelR and CRP alone is unable to activate the melAB promoter . [10760178]
  • Results illustrated in Fig. 7B indicate that expression from the trg regulatory region , like the aer promoter , is dependent on s28 and is activated by CRP . [19843224]
  • In each case , expression is reduced by the HL159 substitution in CRP , while the KE101 substitution reduces expression from the mglB , gatY , sdaC , ychH and malX promoters but not the aer promoter . [17608696]
  • In this case melR is expressed from the CAMP-CRP-independent gulp2 promoter and meli-biose-dependent expression from the melAB promoter in pKK33 appears in both crp + and Acrp cells ( Table II ) . [2851497]
  • Measurements of the expression of this fusion in strain M182 , and in its Dcrp derivative , show that , in contrast to the malX promoter , the malI promoter is active in the absence of CRP , with a modest 1.7-fold stimulation by CRP ( Table 1 ) . [19054084]
  • At the pmelR promoter , expression is dependent on CRP ( 3 ) , so lacZ cloned under pmelR is expressed in the ∆ melR strain in the absence of MelR303 and MelR173 ( Table 3 ) . [12060687]
  • The expression of the galS promoter is absolutely dependent upon CRP . [8416900]
  • Mutations in CRP sites 1 and 4 did not signiﬁcantly alter expression from the rhaSR promoter . [16166533]
  • It is now clear that CAMP and CRP regulate ODC expression as a function of the speC promoter . [3021588]
  • The RhaS autoregulation mechanism is unusual in that a transcriptional activator protein functions to decrease expression of an operon by activating transcription , but not allowing a second activator protein -- in this case CRP -- to coactivate transcription . [19854903]
  • The expression of the LamB protein in hns and hns-stpA strains can be restored by CRP * at 37 ° C but not at 30 ° C . [9829919]
  • The expression of the MalT protein is not restored by CRP * in hns and hns-stpA mutant strains . [9829919]
  • It has been shown that the three proteins ChbR , CRP and NagC regulate the expression of the chb operon . [18028317]
  • This is similar to the situation at the m & A region where expression of the malPQ operon is under the control of maltose and muIT which , in turn , is regulated by CAMP-CRP ( Raibaud and Schwartz , 1984 ) . [2851497]
  • This suggests that CRP may control expression of the operon indirectly . [10537212]
  • In addition , the expression level of the lsrACDBFG operon is much higher in wild-type cells than in the luxS mutant , as CRP is required for its activation ( 50 ) . [16321939]
  • In contrast , the effects of a crp mutation on operon expression were still observed when an upstream putative CRP box was deleted ( Results ; Table 3 ) . [9171388]
  • When E. coli is growing in glucose minimal medium , nanA expression is barely detectable due to inactivation of CRP and repression by NanR ( 4 , 7 ) . [23935044]
  • Evidently , CRP , and not FNR , was required for the expression of ClyA in hns mutants under anoxic conditions , although it appeared that FNR could partly complement CRP . [11053378]
  • It is possible that expression of aer and trg is required only in response to conditions that induce CRP activity and not in response to other signals that induce the ﬂagellar cascade . [19843224]
  • However , when the downstream activator is CRP , then expression of FF-CC is observed with CRP alone ; that is , it is not co-dependent . [8748035]
  • It is necessary to have both MalT and the mutated form of CRP ( CRP * ) to induce mal gene expression in sfsl-dependent systems . [2013578]
  • The activation of FlhDC expression by CRP is reduced by repression of crp by RpoS , a pathway independent of the csgD and cpxR genes ( Fig. 6 ) . [24272779]
  • An lrp mutation reduced csiD expression only when the CRP box was located at the positions highly productive for activation ( Fig. 8 ) . [11532138]
  • In the cya mutant strain , CRP would not be bound to its site , and AraC would be the only activator of araBAD expression . [10940041]
  • By altering the DNA site for CRP to reduce its similarity to the consensus , ClyA expression was signiﬁcantly lowered . [11053378]
  • Why do spacing changes at -203 but not spacing changes in the CRP site affect araBAD expression ? [2521619]
  • Although the single CRP site is involved in activation of both araBAD expression and araC expression , different mutations in the site did not affect expression to the same extent . [2521619]
  • Since there is no detectable rhaBAD activation by CRP in the absence of RhaS , it was not possible to test the effect of a-D235 expression on CRP activation independent of RhaS activation . [10852886]
  • Similarly , restoring CRP did not enhance hlyE expression , despite the absence of glucose ( Fig. 2a ) . [14996792]
  • As a control we also assayed fadH expression and found that expression decreased in the absence of CRP ( Fig. 6E and F ) ( Fig. 7D ) . [23029459]
  • Western blot analysis conﬁrms that , in this system , expression of s28 does not require CRP ( Fig . [19843224]
  • The Northern blot in Fig. 4 ( EF528 ) and the Western blot in Fig. 7B indicate that CRP does repress gadX expression at the TABLE 3 . [12446650]
  • CRP represses the system largely by inhibiting the production of RpoS , the sigma factor primarily responsible for gadX expression . [12446650]
  • CRP appears to negatively regulate gadX expression by virtue of its effects on RpoS production . [12446650]
  • This conﬁrms that both CRP and s28 are essential for expression from the aer regulatory region in vivo . [19843224]
  • This suggested that CRP might repress gadA and gadBC indirectly by regulating gadX expression . [12446650]
  • Regulation of expression of the ulaG and ulaA divergent promoters by CRP , IHF , and FNR . [14996803]
  • We also tested whether DNA bending by CRP inﬂuenced rhaSR expression . [16166533]
  • CRP also represses gadX expression . [12446650]
  • Therefore , contrary to expectation , CRP does not appear to be involved in regulating ftnA expression . [20015147]
  • RhaS activates rhaSR expression , but CRP coactivation is reduced . [19854903]
  • CRP regulates expression of gcvA but does not regulate gcvR . [10074087]
  • sfm expression is under catabolite expression mediated by CRP . [20345943]
  • Role of CRP AR1 and AR2 in rhaBAD expression . [10852886]
  • Various genes , including rpoS and several sigma S-dependent genes , such as bolA , are negatively controlled by cAMP-CRP ( 20 , 21 ) . [11292794]
  • Expression of the deoCA genes from the P-2 promoter is known to be controlled positively by cAMP/CRP and negatively by the cytR repressor , the inducer being cytidine ( J0rgensen et al. , 1977 ; Valentin-Hansen et al. , 1978 ) . [6329724]
  • Two other E. coli loci are controlled negatively by cytR and deoR and positively by the CAMP-CRP complex . [2115441]
  • Initiations from P2 are both negatively controlled by the deoR repressor and the cytR repressor ( the inducer being cytidine ) ( 5-6 ) and positively controlled by the cAMP/CRP complex ( 7 ) . [6087276]
  • These genes are induced by many different stress responses ( K.L. Jones and K.E. Rudd , unpublished ) , and several are regulated by CRP . [18710431]
  • Although many more promoters are positively controlled by the CAMP-CRP system , several genes are also negatively regulated . [3540312]
  • These confirmed that the acnA gene resembles other citric acid cycle genes in being positively regulated by the CAMP-CRP complex and negatively regulated by ArcA . [8000525]
  • This growth-phase-dependent pattern resembles that observed for CRP-regulated genes such as the cst genes , mcc , and glgCAP ( 22 , 31 ) , suggesting that dctA is also regulated by CRP ( see below ) . [10482502]
  • This suggests that csiE and poxB are regulated by a similar mechanism.Since the poxB promoter region does not contain a CRP box , it seems likelythat poxB and also csiEare regulated by an unknown intermediate activator that is itself under the control of cAMP-CRP . [8596457]
  • cspA promoter , not known to be regulated by CRP ( our unpublished results ) , is used as a control in these assays . [24509317]
  • In summary , these results dem-onstrate that gntT is positively regulated by CRP . [9537375]
  • This upregulation was not surprising since gltA is known to be regulated by several regulators such as CAMP-CRP , acrA and fir ( 16 ) . [16233096]
  • This compound is known , to increase - in vitro transcription of operons - regulated by CRP ( 18 ) . [6292893]
  • Finally , many operons in these pathways are regulated by CRP . [11115104]
  • In E. coli , operons caiTABCDE and fixABCX are modulated positively by general regulators , such as the AMPc receptor protein ( CRP ) or the transcriptional regulator responsible for anaerobic induction ( FNR ) , and negatively by the DNA-binding protein H-NS , glucose , or nitrate ( Eichler et al. , 1994a ; Unden and Trageser 1991 ) . [14595781]
  • CHR activity was always high because the cai operon ( responsible for the expression of carnitine metabolism ) was controlled by protein regulators such as FNR ( transcriptional regulator under anaerobic conditions ) , catabolic repression via protein receptor ( CRP ) of AMPc , histones ( H-NS ) , and the transcriptional factor j 2 ( RpoS ) , which is expressed when the cell reaches the stationary phase of growth and inhibits carnitine metabolism ( Eichler et al. , 1996 ) . [14595781]
  • Transcriptional monocopy lacZ fusion studies showed that both operons are coexpressed during anaerobic growth in the presence of carnitine , respond to common environmental stimuli ( like glucose and nitrate ) , and are modulated positively by the same general regulators , CRP and FNR , and negatively by H-NS . [9573142]
  • Like cai and ﬁx operons , the caiF gene appeared to be positively controlled by CRP and FNR and negatively controlled by H-NS and the NarL ( plus nitrate ) regulator . [9573142]
  • ( 1991 ) 218 , 129-140 Molecular and Functional Characterization of a Carbon Starvation Gene of Escherichia coli J. E. Schultz and A. Matint Department of Microbiology and Immunology Sherman Fairchild Science Building Stanford University School of Medicine Stanford , CA 94305-5402 , U.S.A. ( Received 3 May 1990 ; accepted 16 October 1990 ) Escherichia coli induces the synthesis of at least 30 proteins at the onset of carbon starvation , two-thirds of which are positively regulated by the cyclic AMP ( CAMP ) and CAMP receptor protein ( CRP ) complex . [1848300]

[3021588]
  • ( 1988 ) 203 , 564-583 Positive and Negative Regulators for Glucitol ( gut ) Operon Expression in Escherichia coli Mamoru Yamadat and Milton H. Saier Jr Department of Biology The John Muir College University of California at San Diego La Jolla , CA 92093 , U.S.A. ( Received 20 August 1987 , and in revised form 16 February 1988 ) Expression of the glucitol ( gut ) operon in Escherichia coli is regulated by an unusual , complex system which consists of an activator ( encoded by the gutM gene ) and a repressor ( encoded by the gutR gene ) in addition to the cAMP-CRP complex ( CRP , CAMP receptor protein ) . [3062173]
  • , 1990 ) and the regulation of lacZYA operon ( encoding a lactose-utilizingsystem ) by Lac1 ( a specific repressor ) and CAMP-CRP complex ( a global modulator ) in E. coli . [8821940]
  • Such is the case for complex II in E. coli , with the complex II bio-synthetic operon ( sdhCDAB ) being negatively regulated by ArcAB and FNR in response to oxygen conditions ( i.e. anaerobic ) and positively regulated by CRP in the absence of glucose [ 108 -- 110 ] . [22985599]

  • When osmotic regulation of osmY in minimal medium was assayed in a Acya Acrp background ( RO82 ) , csi-5 : : lacZ expression was already increased in exponential phase and could be further stimulated by adding 0.3 M NaCl . [8253679]
  • The increased exponential phase expression of both fusion constructs in the Acrp background is probably due to the strongly elevated levels of os in cya and crp mutants ( Lange and Hengge-Aronis , 1991b ; Lange and Hengge-Aronis , 1994a ) . [8596457]
